title: Manchester United transfer news: Moussa Dembele keen on Premier League move
text:
Moussa Dembele is attracted to interest from Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

Lyon striker Moussa Dembele is reportedly keen on a return to England amid interest from Manchester United.

The Frenchman came through Fulham’s academy and attracted interest from a host of Premier League clubs before a surprising move north of the border to Celtic.

Dembele spent a goal-laden two years at Parkhead before an acrimonious exit to Lyon in 2018, where he’s scored 26 goals in 56 matches for the Ligue 1 giants.

The 23-year-old has long been of interest to United but Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is particularly keen on Dembele given the club’s problems in front of goal.

Dembele is valued at around £45m (Picture: Getty)

Romelu Lukaku was allowed to leave for Inter Milan without a ready-made replacement and Solskjaer has been given the £74m from the Belgian’s departure to reinvest in the side.

Dembele is valued at around £45m by Lyon and the French club insist he is not for sale.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But ESPN report that the striker is keen on a return to England and United have the finances to pull off a deal.

United take on Chelsea in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday and both sides are expected to ring the changes.

Solskjaer’s side beat the Blues 4-0 on the opening weekend of the season but Frank Lampard’s men have made more progress since and sit seven points ahead of the Red Devils in the table.
